alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the City of Norfolk, the central City of Chesapeake, the southeastern City of Portsmouth and the northwestern City of Virginia Beach through 415 PM EDT... At 322 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Great Bridge, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Virginia Wesleyan University, Old Dominion University, Downtown Norfolk, Regent University, Ocean View, Great Bridge, Kempsville, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Norfolk State University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Fentress, Norfolk International, Norfolk NAS, Ghent, Norview and Cradock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
